description: Possibly a portmanteau of "carbon" (or hydrocarbon) and burette, a device for dispensing accurately measured quantities of liquid.  A carburettor dispenses petrol at a controlled rate according to the position of a throttle pedal or lever.

verbs.description: carburet (third-person singular simple present carburets, present participle carbureting or carburetting, simple past and past participle carbureted or carburetted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To mix (air) with hydrocarbons, especially with petroleum, as in an internal combustion engine.
